conclusion: Objects A and B are cloth pieces, and objects C, D, E, and F are upright blocks.
Object A is a pink cloth, object B is a patterned cloth, object C is a white block, object D is a brown block, object E is a green block, and object F is another green block.
Due to gravity, objects A and B will fall straight down.
The cloth pieces (A and B) will drape over the blocks (C, D, E, and F) that lie beneath them.
The cloths will conform to the shapes of the blocks beneath them.
The cloths will come to rest on the tabletop after draping over the blocks.
The blocks (C, D, E, and F) will stay in their original positions and will not move.
